hook.translation[0].definitions[0].defin: a curved piece of metal or plastic that you use for hanging things on
hook.translation[0].definitions[0].examp: Tom hung his coat on the hook behind the door.
hook.translation[0].definitions[1].defin: a curved piece of thin metal with a sharp point for catching fish
hook.translation[0].definitions[2].defin: something that is attractive and gets people’s interest and attention
hook.translation[0].definitions[2].examp: You always need a bit of a hook to get people to go to the theatre.
hook.translation[0].definitions[3].defin: a way of hitting your opponent in boxing, in which your elbow is bent
hook.translation[1].definitions[0].defin: to catch a fish with a hook
hook.translation[1].definitions[0].examp: I hooked a 20-pound salmon last week.
hook.translation[1].definitions[1].defin: to fasten or hang something onto something else
hook.translation[1].definitions[1].examp: Just hook the bucket onto the rope and lower it down.
hook.translation[1].definitions[2].defin: to bend your finger, arm, or leg, especially so that you can pull or hold something else
hook.translation[1].definitions[2].examp: Ruth hooked her arm through Tony’s.
He tried to hook his leg over the branch.
hook.translation[1].definitions[3].defin: to succeed in making someone interested in something or attracted to something
hook.translation[1].definitions[3].examp: cigarette ads designed to hook young people
hook.translation[1].definitions[4].defin: to connect a piece of electronic equipment to another piece of equipment or to an electricity supply
hook.translation[1].definitions[4].examp: We’ve got a CD player, but it’s not hooked up yet.
Computers from different manufacturers can often be hooked together.
hook.translation[1].definitions[5].defin: to throw or kick a ball so that it moves in a curve
hook.translation[2].definitions[0].examp: These tactics have helped hook such big clients as Coca-Cola.
hook.translation[2].definitions[1].defin: to connect one piece of electronic equipment to another piece of equipment or to an electricity supply
hook.translation[2].definitions[1].examp: Hook one of the telephone lines to the fax machine.
hook.translation[3].definitions[0].examp: Free hotel rooms are one of the hooks designed to bring in new clients.
hook.translation[3].definitions[1].defin: if a person or business is off the hook, they are allowed to get out of a difficult situation, especially one they might have been punished for
hook.translation[3].definitions[1].examp: The broker isn’t off the hook yet for the security violations.
hook.translation[3].definitions[2].defin: to have to pay for something, especially something that is not really your responsibility
hook.translation[3].definitions[2].examp: Two dozen banks are on the hook for at least $100 million each.
